phrases.usage: Use this polite expression to tell the waiter your hot drink is not warm enough.
phrases.example: Excuse me, this hot latte is very cold and old.

phrases.usage: Say this phrase when the server brings a different drink than the one you bought.
phrases.example: This is the wrong order because I asked for tea.

phrases.usage: Use this to ask the staff to change or correct a mistake with your drink.
phrases.example: The drink is not sweet, can you fix it, please?

phrases.text: Can I have a new one?
phrases.usage: Request a fresh replacement if your current drink is not good to drink.
phrases.example: My coffee is bitter, can I have a new one?

phrases.usage: Tell the server that you want both milk and sugar in your next drink.
phrases.example: I would like a small latte with milk and sugar.

phrases.usage: Use this to confirm you do not want any sugar in your new coffee.
phrases.example: I want a fresh black coffee with no sugar, please.

phrases.usage: A polite way for staff to apologize when a mistake happens at the cafe.
phrases.example: I am sorry about that, I will help you now.

phrases.usage: Use this to tell the customer that a fresh drink is coming very soon.
phrases.example: Please wait a moment, I will bring a new one.

keyVocabulary.definition: A sharp and strong taste that is not sweet.
Something that is newly made and good to consume.
Something that is right or exactly what you wanted.
Being kind and showing good manners to other people.
Having a pleasant taste like sugar or honey.
